Had an awesome evening and will definitely keep this place in mind when wanting to get together for a family style dinner.
author: Artem K.

description: The beef tongue and the rabbit stew are enough reasons why you have to visit this place. I was really blown away.
author: Matt B.

description:
I'm conflicted about this place. Overall the food was good and it has a nice environment. The entire time I was in this place, me and my friend were the only ones speaking English, so you know it must be legit. 

Anyways, the bread and pilimini were both real good; however the main course of stuffed cabbage was only mediocre. If the cabbage had been about 8-9 bucks I wouldn't have been bothered, but at 15 bucks I expected more. I've had cabbage rolls in Lithuania that blew my socks off that only cost like 5 bucks. So like most Russian restaurants in SF this one is overpriced. Me and my friend ate here and we ended up spending 30$ each for an appetiser, main course and a beer.

Would I come back to here again? Maybe, depends if I had a bunch of money I wanted to burn and a hunger for Russian food.
author: Joe D.

description: Service was poor.  They had a large group at the same time we were there, staff was overwhelemed and we were ignored. Ordered black caviar which was on the menu, but they did not have. Was hoping for a better experience with all the reviews, will not go back.
author: Kimberly R.

description: Food was authentic Russian and Romanian. Service was really good. Ate a ton of food and it didn't work out to be expensive. Just right.
author: Michelle K.

description: The tastiest Pilaf that I have ever had. Also the most expensive pilaf that I have ever had. From a business standpoint, $14 for 2.5 servings of pilaf is a damn profit. So was $18 for a Beef Stroganoff, but god was it buttery. Nevertheless, we had a wonderful time. The zucchini pancake appetizer was delicious. The smoked salmon was a wonderful add. The setting was clean and quiet. I guess my complaints are a bit petty.
author: Lily Z.

description:
I brought a couple of people here who had never tried Russian food before. I recommended the pelmeni because it's a staple, so one ended up getting the Siberian pelmeni. Another got the vareniki, and I got the fried pelmeni since I'd never seen that version before. I also got solyanka as an appetizer.

I had never had solyanka before because it's just not something my family makes for some reason, so this was my first time. It's basically smoked sausage soup with some vegetables. I enjoyed it.

The vareniki were just like my grandma makes them and and the pelmeni were also spot on. The fried pelmeni were pretty much what you'd expect, good but not amazing.

For drinks we got kvas and compot, which were both good. It inspired me to make my own compot the next day. The servers were also very nice, no "soviet style" service here!

I kind of wished there were some cold soups on the menu. I was craving some green borscht or okroshka on a warm day.
author: Liat N.

description: Very delicious food and good service at a reasonable price!   No corkage fee!  Perfect place to celebrate a birthday or just treat yourself to an amazing dinner with authentic Russian food!  We came with a party of 7 and we all agreed about how good it was.
author: Vitaly W.

description: Made a reservation with them and when I try to confirm it. They said I never made a reservation. The guy seems really rude about it too. Really bad customer service and will never want to come back for this restaurant.
author: Crystal W.

description: Everything was awesome, good service. Khorcho soup  was very good. The rabbit dish was big enough and tasty.
author: Alex S.

description:
My boyfriend (from out of town) selected this restaurant off of yelp. He told me he wanted to try something new. The restaurant itself it very nice, warm, and well decorated. The waitress was friendly, which was also a plus.
 The food on the other hand was not good. We started with the potato dumplings. They were okay. I ordered the rice pilaf. This was bad. The lamb was really dry and there was about a 1/4 inch of grease in the little crock pot they served it in. Also compared to all the other servings it was a tiny portion. My boyfriend got the pan fried veal. The veal was also super greasy. The side of cauliflower was seasoned really nicely though. We attempted to get Russian Tea Service for two, but the waitress informed us they did not have this available. We ended up getting a tea and a dessert wine. Overall, not somewhere I would go again.
author: Whitney G.

description: Had an hour before show time, and realized it's no longer an hour after having trouble finding parking. I made the reservation on open table, called the restaurant and told them that I was running late and I wanted to make sure that I could order food and still make the movie.  Never been to a Russian restaurant before (unless you count Moscow Restaurant in Beijing and Haerbin, China), so it was quite an adventure. The lady of the house made sure that I got sat right away, told the waiter that I was running to the movie and had 40 minutes to eat. Asked what was authentic, and quick. She recommended a few things but I am an adventure eater. I went for the rabbit stew and beef tongue. Well.. Rabbit stew, a total hit. Beef Tongue, way better than others. It's late and I'm writing a review and I'm craving, all of sudden, rabbit stew again. I'm a fan. Impeccable service. And judging by the fact that I'm the only Asian and everyone else is Russian in the restaurant, I think for my first venture into Russian cuisine, this is a pretty hard place to beat for first timers. Yes the fried, or roasted cauliflower, is a definite hit. I will for sure come back to try their pile of meat. Couldn't be happier with their service.
author: Victoria E.

description: First time I had Russian food and it was great.  The service have very good customer service and the food was amazing... Make sure to have the caviar and crapes
author: Seth J.

description: Delicious smoked salmon, caviar, smoked herring, and belini platter. Served with sour cream. Never had anything like it and was amazed.
author: Liz G.

description: I enjoyed my visit to this Russian restaurant a lot. I came for a party, so the food was ordered banquet style, but it was all very good. The cold appetizers were all very fresh, and all the meat was very good. They had large serving sizes, polite waiters, and fast service. Also, the napoleon cake was very sweet. I hope to come back again soon, and order from the regular menu.
author: Nikita K.

description: The food at this place is to die for, everything was amazing. i mean everything that the bring to the table was just amazing. we got the meat plate to share and it was my most enjoyed. the rack of lamb was cooked perfectly. We went as a group of 7 for my birthday and just ordered from the menu. ended up paying 350 for all the food. wonderful
author: Ilona O.

description:
I gave them 2 stars because of the service we had while we were here. According to all the reviews, this restaurant is a good place to try Russian food and it's our first time ever trying Russian food. We gave it a try. It's a nice restaurant. The food was good but the service here is quite not what I'm looking for. 
First of all, servers are not speaking english very well, I'm not annoyed by that since I'm a foreigner also and got used to that fact. Negativity for menu knowledge, our server took forever to get our order and drinks. He forgot to put in our appetizer and main course. After waiting for over 30 mins, we decided to ask where is our food, the answer we got is "I'm sorry, we kind of forgetting about your food" WTF is that supposed to mean? There are 2 tables in the whole restaurant and they forgot about us? It's quite upsetting. They tried to compliment us with free wine and beer but never came back to take our free drinks order.. Luckily we didn't want any alcohol other wise we will have to wait for an hour for the drinks to come out. 
Other than the horrible service that we had today, Everything else is worth the try. I hope the service will get better for other people.
author: Thao P.

description:
Came here with a friend for a light dinner on a cold, wet night.  We were a bit hesitant about the atmosphere because there was a large (25+) group of Russians having a private party (there's only one main room in the place) but this turned out to add to our enjoyment of the dinner.  (Thankfully there was no music or dancing!).

We started with the Zucchini Salmon Tartar appetizer, two large patties with delicious smoked salmon 'salsa' although the zucchini patties were limp not crispy so that was a little disappointing.  The two soups we ordered were large portions and very hot.  I loved the borsch (one of the best I've ever had - rich broth, lovely vegetables, perfect consistency) but my friend thought the matzo ball soup was a little bland.

The pelmeni were nice (little meatballs that get dribbled with sour cream) and very authentic.  There is a small selection of house wine that come with a nice big pour.  Our waiter was very attentive and the space is warm and inviting.  This is a really nice addition to the Outer Richmond, particularly if you're looking for something other than Asian food.
author: Andrea J.

description:
Loved the food.
The steamed veal dumplings are great. 
The beef Stroganoff was great. 
The service was amazing and this is a gem of a place.
Highly recommended.
author: l H.

description: Delicious food! I highly recommend the cabbage rolls and sour cherry dumplings! Love the dimly lit, romantic atmosphere. The place is decorated with nice paintings. Would love to go there again
author: Kristina K.

description: Always AS GOOD AS IT GET'S !!! Last night we went for dinner their because I help one of the owner buy a car from me and it was great !!! Super fresh food and really good staff and I love to dine here all the time...... You can not find a better Russian Place in City that can make you a better food then Red Tarven......We Will see you soon again and Enjoy Your New CAR !!!
author: Boris M.

description: I have no idea whether its the real thing or not, but the khinkali was great, as was the meat soup.
author: George T.

description: I came here for a late afternoon lunch after a good hike at Lands End.  I had the Pelmeny Soup, grilled beef tongue & the Zucchini pancake.  They were all very delicious.  The soup really did it for me.  I'm glad for the helpful tips from yelpers...
author: Michael L.

description: This place is great!  Delicious food and so many local Russians!  I LOVE the atmosphere.  Felt like I was back in Moscow!
author: Erick Z.

description:
So my first experience here was terrible and I was very close to writing them a horrible 1 star review, but for some reason I held back. My family and I made a reservation for 50 people for a wake. We asked the owner if a banquet of $50 a person (with our own alcohol and beverages), she said that we will have plenty of everything and not to worry about order a more expensive menu. So we didn't.

Well...we aren't sure if trusting her was the best idea. The appetizer were spread across the plate and we didn't have 50 people we ended up closer to 40 and there was not enough (they didn't even serve everything that was listed on the pre-fix menu). The hot food didn't come out for 2 hours..yes, 2 hours..and lot of our party had already left. It really sucked considering someone had to go rush them to serve the food already and they abruptly apologized and went to speed up the process. Although scarce, what they did serve was very tasty.

Now..you're probably wondering why 4 stars? Well we accidentally went back here for a smaller birthday celebration, because we were in the neighborhood and it was much cuter than any of the other places in the neighborhood. 3 months later and we were blown away! They got rid of some of the waiters that really had no idea what they were doing and got much better, quicker waiters! Although we are russian and most russian restaurants don't serve good, authentic food...this place is really good! 

Pros: 
Tasty food
Trendy & Warm decor 
Fast service
A great, comfortable atmosphere for a quick bite or a celebration. 
Affordable

Cons:
Questionable pre-fix menu (you may or may not be pleased)
Unreliable based on our past experience.

Will we back? Yes, definitely! They totally made up for last time :)
author: Elena L.

description:
Wow. Since this place changed ownership, it has turned into a gourmand's Heaven.

I've been to the old restaurant a few times, and was not impressed. The new owners have a wizard in the kitchen, and the atmosphere is quiet (except for an occasional jolly group of patrons) and tasteful.

First time, we ordered Romanian polenta appetizer (delicious), Beef Stroganoff (not the best of their dishes... but then I'm spoiled by home cooked Stroganoff) and fried cauliflower (excellent).

The second time we visited, we didn't even get farther than appetizers and soup - there's just too much to sample. 

Zucchini pancakes with salmon were out of this world - pancakes were mild, light and fried in a way that kept them as oil free as possible, diced salmon of excellent quality, and the spices and sauce made me want to commit crimes for the recipe. 

We also got Romanian polenta (again, it's that good) which is fluffy and firm, with melted butter and feta cheese flakes, and grilled tongue. You have to try the grilled tongue. Slender, melty soft slices are juicy inside, and perfectly crispy in the right places. No description does it justice.

Borsch was heavy on beets and light on cabbage, served with thick and fresh sour cream, and better than my mom made (sorry, mom). Lobster bisque was extremely creamy, and, while there wasn't too many lobster pieces, tasted as it should - of lobster. In fact, this is the lobsterest lobster bisque I yet had in San Francisco.

I always order a pitcher of fruit compote flavored with raspberry juice  - you can have beer or wine anywhere, but this is their own specialty and well worth passing booze for.
author: Sandra B.

description: Pleasently surprised. There are not that many Russian restaurants in SF but this one definitely stands out. The food tastes very authentic and delicious. Be aware of the portions, they are quite generous.
author: Ricardo Y.

description: Delicious food! Great service! I highly suggest you come here to experience traditional Russian food!
author: Olga L.

description: Sometimes the public is very skeptical when it comes to new restaurants in local areas just being opened.  Well, you don't have to be when you go here.  When I walked into the Red Tavern, I was very impressed with the new design, the atmosphere, the wood based genre that it projected and most of all the food and service.  Excellent and "Thumbs Up" across the board.  This place is "top notch"!!!!! It's about time that someone in the European "Cuisine Seen" has stepped up and created a wonderful restaurant with classic/modern design and a "heart whelmed" welcome as you enter the Tavern.  I'm very happy with the owner's decision on making such a place truly a "getaway" for most of us locals.  Thank you Red Tavern! I can't wait to eat there again :)
author: Shant M.

description: The food may be good, but the service is just not worth it.  I have been treated really rudely by the front-of-house staff here on all 3 trips to the restaurant.   Once we were rudely turned away 45 min before closing on a weekend because the staff wanted to close early.  Customer service is not a priority at Red Tavern.
author: Kat S.

description: I hesitate to rate this secret gem in the Richmond for fear of it being discovered by everyone. This place is absolutely incredible. Some of the best food I have ever had in SF. It is great for both large groups or small dining (make sure to have a reservation for either). For dinner, everything tried so far has been delicious. Make sure to save room for dessert, specifically Napoleon cake.
author: Kate D.

description:
This place is OK. 

I've been to Red Tavern twice in the past couple of weeks. Once for lunch with my co-workers and once at a friends birthday party for dinner. 

The Lunch: 
The menu is limited, but everything on it was available . We were the only ones at the restaurant so our waiter handled our party beautifully. Overall, everyone had a positive gastronomic  experience and it was fun. 

The Dinner: 
We had 20-25 people, and one waiter. I felt really bad for the guy. He was really trying hard to keep up, but, he was only a man. He gave it his best but ultimately kept failing. One of us was always waiting for something or he would spill, ice the wrong drinks or do a number of other things a failing waiter would.  (We still tipped very generously -- it was not his fault.)

The food overall:
This is the main reason that i am rating at 3 stars.  
There are a few staple dishes which every Russian joint on this side of the Atlantic serves it's customers. These dishes make up a hybrid cuisine -- "emigrant food". There are Russian, Ukrainian, French and Central Asian dishes which have found its way onto the same spread. 
Red Taver's kitchen puts out average food and if you are not of post-Soviet heritage or don't have a mama or a babushka at home cooking for you its the close to the best emigrant food you are going to get in the city. For those of you who eat Olivier salad which is finely chopped and is not swimming in mayo at home; Red Tavern is going to be a disappointment. Go for the Greek salad.   If you are used to your buckwheat to be fried with onions, again the Red Tavern is probably going to come up short. Go for the deep-fried potatoes with essence of garlic -- pretty good and standard. 
The meat, a central Asian specialty, has its hits and misses. The lamb is over marinated and overcooked. You cant even taste that its lamb. Some people like that i guess -- I don't. The filet let me know right away that the chef does not know that meat needs to be aged before cooking. Sure; it was properly seasoned and grilled, but, it tasted like nothing.  The chicken a-la Kiev and pan fried game hens were good. The soups taste great, but the chef has to skim the fat. Small droplets pooling separately are OK in hearty soups, but a thin layer which is connected all around is not.  

In order to compete and survive Red Tavern is forced to take a more aggressive approach in their menu and their staffing. Both need work. 

In my opinion, if they would do Russian dishes extra well and someone brings it out as ordered and on time my review would be a 5-Star. Or things can just be left as is until the next re-brand/remodel.

I cant wait to come back and taste the change.
author: Leo S.

description: This was the most delicious food I have tasted in a very long time!! Everything we ordered was amazing!!! We got the Beef Stroganoff and the Bitocheck with the cauliflower and tavern potatoes, everything was outstanding! Very flavorful, and you certainly get your money's worth! The main courses were very filling. Went on a Wednesday night for dinner, there were a few other locals in at the time. Our waiter was very nice and helpful! The restaurant has nice decor, and the food makes you feel right at home. Couldn't have had a better night!
author: Kayla O.

description:
I haven't tried Russian food there but never try to eat Georgian food, it's the most disgusting place for Georgian food, it's even not a bit like the food it originally should be.
Qartvelebo ar miqarot da ar chamot khinkali an qababi
author: Tamta M.

description: Delicious Russian food, great ambiance, and cozy atmosphere. Great place to recommend for anyone looking for some Russian authentic food. The "Napolean" dessert is yummy!
author: Laina V.

description: This place is remarkable. I have been here for casual dinners, birthday parties, and lunch. The food is always incredible! The waiters are by far the nicest you will see at any Russian restaurant. This place is genuinly a good time. You can have an elegant 5 star dinner, or a roudy time with all your closest friends! This is my type of place!
author: TheOneAndOnly T.

description: So bad that I had to write a review. Looked it up on yelp and the reviews were good, but I should have known better because that doesn't mean nothing. Walked in with two friends, and it was freezing cold and windy that day. Thy have one of their menus posted outside but like I said, it was way to chilly outside to willingly stand there, so we walked inside and asked to see a menu and the waitress gave us a snotty look and pointed outside to the one that's taped to the window. Like duh, were not stupid. We told her it was effin cold outside so she went to bring us one. Moving on....we started to order. Heard the zucchini cakes were their specialty so we asked for an order. The waitress said they don't have any yet because the kitchen isn't done making them. I WORK IN A KITCHEN AS A CHEF FOR A LIVING. If the food prep is not done when you open then you pretty much failed that day. Period. Next......we blow it off and ask for the fried calamari. She gives a weird look and says she thinks they don't have any so she goes to the kitchen and checks and sure enough, they don't. Her excuse is "most people don't order seafood here so we don't carry it." WTF???????? So, you basically just insulted us on our choices of food and gave us a crappy excuse at the same time. Why the hell is it on your menu!???? So dumb. Onward.......even after her whole seafood thing we ask if they have the prawns in garlic wine sauce. She gives a terrified look and says she has to check in the kitchen once again. Wow. We should have just walked out but she comes back and says they intact do have the prawns and On top of that, the zucchini cakes are ready. We order one of each. The prawns were cooked to chewy oblivion and the zucchini cakes were ice cold and soggy. FML. Afterward our entrees came and after an annoying mix up on what potatoes go on who's plate (waitresses fault of course), we start to eat. The beef stroganoff I got was soooooooo chewy and dry and my friend got burned puffed pastry on hers. Hahahahaha. It's just funny now. Lets admit that. But we stopped laughing once the $80 bill came for some of the worst food and service and professionalism I ever encountered I'm my life. I'm done. Just wanted my experience out there.
author: mel l.

description: I have left a rather unfavorable review for Red Tavern years ago; the restaurant has changed ownership long since, and under the current management, it is simply wonderful. Great food and service -- proper authentic Russian cuisine with all the staple dishes present; not much else to say. Particularly great meat dishes. No hard liquor unfortunately, so you won't get a couple shots of vodka with your borsch but otherwise, nothing to gripe about.
author: M M.

description: Unbelievably rude behavior at Red Tavern. We made a reservation for 4 people through OpenTable.  We showed up on-time. The place was full of large parties having celebrations. We waited for several minutes before someone came out from the back to talk with us.  A wait person/staff person came and asked "can I help you?" to which we replied, "we have a reservation for 4 for (our name)".  He looked at us and said "4? no." and then turned and walked away back into the kitchen.  Really?  We double checked. Yup. We had a reservation. Don't know if it's just a difference in culture, but I would have expected them to at least check his system and apologize for their mistake of (apparently) over-booking their reservations.
author: Grace F.

description:
The Beautiful place, delicious food,  friendly waiters and not expensive...  
I  will definitely come again !!!  : )
author: Ety K.

description: Asshat waiter refused to serve us, telling us that unless we had a reservation he couldn't seat us... despite almost 10 empty tables and only three parties in the whole restaurant. I realize he may have been working alone and was stressed out, but if you're overwhelmed, just say so. I don't need attitude. Try Stroganoff down by Fisherman's Wharf - great Russian food and friendly servers who will actually serve you.
author: Adam R.

description: Been to this place MANY times and always left satisfied. Food is great. Ive tried almost all their dishes and everything is always yummy! I especially love the mamliga (polenta)
author: Jolly L.

description:
THIS PLACE IS EXCELLENT!!

We ate at Red Tavern last night for dinner with a party of 12. All the food was absolutely amazing. The olivier was the best I've had since my grandma used to make it for me as a child. Also we had the meat platter- both the chicken and the lulli kabbob were prepared to perfection. The garlic potatoes were seasoned just right and were perfectly crispy. We also had blini stuffed with meat which are a signature dish at this restaurant because I have never had anything like that in any other restaurant. Other people at our table had dumplings stuffed with cherries and ordered second portions because they were just that good and the rest of the table had to have a tasting. It was a perfect blend of authentic russian food, which brought back a lot of nostalgia from my childhood and my grandmothers famous Russian dishes. 

The waiters and all the service were really great, we got our food VERY fast, didn't have to wait long (which is a pet peeve for me b/c I don't like waiting at restaurants to get my food)! The waiters kept asking us if everything was ok and if we needed anything.  

ALL in all, this place is definitely on my top list of new favorite restaurants and my wife and I can't wait to go back to try more of the menu!
author: Robert S.

description:
What a pleasant surprise and a departure from the unfortunate examples of the Russian food in the Bay Area.  First of, all the smoked fish and caviar WAS FRESH!!!!!
Second,although one can argue about the "updated" interior, the place is clean and the bathroom is clean.  Everything we tasted was good and higher.  If you are into exploring Russian cooking, you came to the right place.  Last year, we tried the overpriced Fandorin with its terrible service and shady patrons, and the food there was not good, unless you are friends with the owner, and she will make a favor for you personally. The two male weiters at Red Tavern are polite and in a good mood.  Being from that part of the world myself, it does not happen often.  Red Tavern, we will be back!
author: Inesa D.

description:
Excellent service, decor and food presentation.  The first course - that is the soups are very good also.  

The main dinner dishes we've tried were OK - average in taste.  I'll come back here to try some other dishes but Chicken Kiev didn't impress me at all.
author: Daniel B.

description:
I went there for a birthday party last weekend.  
The place is relatively small, tastefully decorated with beautiful wall artwork, nice architectural details. 

The service was great.  Waiters seem seasoned professionals - elegant and very efficient.  They did a great job keeping guests happy.
 
The food was delicious.   Absolutely loved Mushroom Julienne and Tongue with Horseradish Sauce! Shish-kebab was great!  Still salivating over Napoleon Cake..

Great place for a family party or romantic lunch/dinner.
author: Ben B.

description: Red Tavern is awesome. I've been going here with family since the place used to be called Sadko under different owners. Sadko used to be all russian food that I wasn't particularly fond of. Red Tavern on the other hand has an awesome mix of everyhting. When I went with my family they had zero complaints and loved the food. I was finally delighted to see things that wheren't russian on the menu. Lobster bisque was delicious. Calamari surprisingly amazing. Best of all where the little filet mignon slider things. Can't wait to go back.
author: Dmitriy G.

description: Really solid Russian food. What is THAT, you say? Big chunks of meat and potatoes. Not fancy, highbrow or experimental, but really well prepared ethnic dishes. The night we were there, there were only 2 people working, so don't expect the fastest of service. And yes like other Yelpers have mentioned, there were a number of Russians in the place.
author: Greg H.

description: Disappointed. The baked potatoes and salted fish (herring, salmon) were good. The pickles and russian pancakes (blini) were OK. Their meat dishes (chicken, beef) had simply no taste as if they were frozen and reheated many times. The bulgarian salad was terrible: either the ingredients were not fresh or it was made weeks ago. Not coming back.
author: Dave G.

description: Yum! Great flavors and friendly service. Think of the pace as European..your food will take awhile so give yourself some time and sip your vodka.
author: Jess D.

description: At first I was put off that the service was slow but then I realized this is the kind of place where you are intended to take your time -- order beer, salad, more beer, smoked fish plate, more beer, borscht, more beer, entree, etc... All the food we ordered was so tasty except the beef peirogies.  Coming from Pittsburgh, PA, I prefer a cheese or a mushroom peirogi, which is more Polish than Russian but, oh well.  Anyhow, I hope to go back soon, the place was cozy and I liked the relaxed atmosphere.  We ordered the pickles, smoked fish, beef peirogi, borscht and a salad and many pitchers of beer.
author: Sarah R.

description: Very good Russian Food. The owner is very nice too. Veal Dumplings are Yum!
author: Kate J.

description: I really loved the food at this place. There aren't that many Russian restaurants in San Francisco and I was excited to find it. The food is fantastic and the people who work there are very friendly. I liked talking to them about the food and I think the price is very good for the quality and the portion of the food. I will go back and recommend this place.
author: Mandana T.

description: The restaurant's decor and ambiance was very nice. The staff welcoming and the food incredible.  I recommend the meat blintzes and the stuffed cabbage rolls and look forward to returning to try something else.
author: Michael E.

description: Great place with a great atmosphere. Friendly waitress, I didn't hear much English being spoken but that didnt bother me at all. Great experience and I will be back!
author: Joshua s.

description: I first discovered this neighborhood gem when I took a class in Russian History and picked up our take away order as part of our final class. I had never had russian food so I wasnt sure what to expect.  Katya could not have been nicer, and had everything ready and packed properly so it would stay hot on my drive to Marin. The food was fantastic!  I have since had dinner there three times and would highly recommend. If you plan a weekend dinner,  be sure and make reservations as they were fully booked with larger parties on weekends.
author: c m.

description: The best restaurant, food, and service I've ever been through.  Even parking is not available closer than two blocks away from the restaurant it is worth it. Fancy  box with tea choice and beautiful restaurant decor. Definitely I'll keep returning that place.
author: A. A.

description: Delicious! The waiter was really nice and the food was great... I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Nora D.

description: Quiet. Pleasant. We had a wonderful lunch her today. The food was very good.
author: Rob N.

description:
Bottom line: great food, good experience, go!
My husband and I were both raised in Russia, and going out for Russian food is not normal for us. I am very glad we made the exception.
 We started out with a small bread basket that was a bit disappointing, given the proximity of a superb Russian bakery. The basket contained some dark caraway-laden rye and two white rolls.
We ordered the mushroom julien, harcho, and a salad to share. The red-cabbage salad was a huge portion of yummy, flavor-packed crunch. The waiter knew we were going to share the salad, and placed the plate between us, but did not offer appetizer plates. My DH's soup came out quite a while before my julienne,  and the julienne serving was much smaller than other dishes we saw. It was certainly a sufficient and a delicious portion, just disproportionate. DH loved loved loved his harcho. He also loved his hen "tapaka", and the lamb plof I had was deathly good. They also have the most amazing Kvas - not overly sweet or artificially carbonated - but hubby never got his "kompot", which he ordered in a fit of nostalgia.
We had to pack half our main course to go, so we didn't get to try dessert, but another disappointment to me was seeing the lipton tea bag served to the guests at neighboring table. It really killed the wonderful "podstakanniki" presentation.

Clearly, lots of little things that could be fixed, but I can't wait for an excuse to go back!
author: Lighty L.

description:

great experience, overall.

author: Alex F.

description: Excellent place to have a great evening if you are a fan of Eastern European food. Great ambiance, service, staff, and food!
author: Lena K.

description: disappointed.  finally able to try this place.  really looking forward to try the roasted cornish hen, which this previous place had and it was so good.  crispy skin, moist breast and just so tasty.  this was not it.  overly salty (although tasty), soft skin and just not much meat.  too bad.
author: Food Is L.
